meanings.definition: To edit or prepare something for publication before the final editing process.
meanings.sent1: She likes to preedit her articles before sending them to the editor.
meanings.sent2: I always preedit my work to catch any mistakes before the final review.
meanings.sent3: The writer decided to preedit her novel while sipping tea.
meanings.sent4: He preedited his speech meticulously, ensuring every word was perfect.
meanings.sent5: Preediting is crucial for ensuring the document is error-free.

meanings.definition: The act of editing or preparing something for publication before the final editing process.
meanings.sent1: Preedit is an important step in the publishing process.
meanings.sent2: The preedit of the manuscript was thorough and detailed.
meanings.sent3: The preedit of the book was so well done that it impressed the publisher.
meanings.sent4: The preedit of the report was like a polishing of a gem.
meanings.sent5: The preedit revealed many areas that needed improvement.
